strength: this course is useful to apply survival analysis in solving real issue in the world.

Very good, excellent slides, logical flow of information, fair but labor intensive homeworks. definitely feel able to perform relatively complex survival analysis after taking this class and assess model fit and strengths and weaknesses of different models and their interpretations.
Very organized slides and clear lectures, useful homework that facilitates study
too much homework assignment
The most understandable course
Excellent course
NA
The lectures are very clear. But some homework assignments involve replicative calculation.

I really enjoyed the course. It was challenging but homework assignments helped me a lot to understand the concept. I also liked the applied structure of the homeworks, since some other courses was not keeping their promises for the "applied" part. I appreciated that we've been given more than one software applications for the analyses. The course load was heavy but I still liked the course. The assignments were evaluated in a very timely manner.
The lecture notes are very helpful for understanding knowledge. Hope sample exams could be provided before the exam.

Overall, I think the course was a great learning experience. We covered a lot of material in each class but it was clear and easy to understand. My biggest critique of the course was that exams did not have an appropriate point distribution. I think it was absurd that if you did not understand one concept you could be in jeopardy of losing close to 25 points on an exam which is immediately a drop in two letter grades. I think the points should be more even or that some questions that were described as nominal should not have such a heavy grading. I also think it would be helpful, if there was a project, so that students can use data and have an abstract at the end of the course and be able to get feedback in the course.

It was a great course overall, and the instructor was very good about giving feedback and offering help outside the classroom. 

The 2-hour long classes were just hard to sit through.... not because the lecture was bad but because no one can focus on a subject for that long
This course is really logical and can let you know the core concepts for performing the survival analysis.
It was excellent for a physician scientist who is trying to understand the basic concept of survival analysis as well as how to code for it and apply it to data.
Although it is a long lecture, it is very enjoyable and I learned a lot. The homework assignments also helped strengthen my knowledge.
It might be better to meet twice a week, for a shorter lecture time each
A separate lab session might be helpful.
This course gives students a nice introduction to survival analysis with helpful examples and exercises.

Very good materials for learning survival analysis. Good combination with coding materials and instructions.

Very detailed explanation to the course materials. Good teaching pace and material structure.

Strengths: topic is highly relevant for MPH and PhD students. it was highly relevant to CDE PhD students. Having the code in both SAS and R is excellent and helps students get through the software more easily. 

Weaknesses: The course often deviated from the applied aspect to the theoretical aspects, which in these instances it becomes irrelevant for CDE students. This is demonstrated in that the first exam contained ~6 questions (worth around 30 points) just on calculus material that CDE students do not have experience/expertise on. Furthermore, as a PhD student in CDE, this course could have helped me move along my dissertation research. I have survival data that I could have used to learn all the concept, however, because this option is not available, a lot of my time was spent using hypothetical data. Being allowed to use real data would help me truly internalize the material and move along my own research projects. The opportunity to allow PhD students to use their own data for HW assignments as well as submit an extended abstract as a final paper (rather than exam) would greatly enhance the learning experience with survival analysis. This approach also allows the professor to provide real time feedback into actual research that students are conducting. Otherwise, most of the assignments for me were busy work. The final exam is easier, but also irrelevant to my education as a PhD student. I would benefit more from applying these concepts to my data and get feedback, than from memorizing formulas and steps for an exam. The former is more aligned with real world applications of survival analysis.
Its a good course. Everything is clear. The instructor might consider explaining the code on the slides a little bit more.
It gives a good introduction to survival analysis.
good course, wished it had a lab to go over the output and do individual projects
Lot of work but very well-taught and straightforward. The tests were also fair. The lectures were pretty dry, but Prof. Ciarleglio was very nice.

Good course on survival analysis. The lectures and notes are very organized and thorough. The professor and TA are approachable, knowledgeable, and eager to help. Our TA was incredible- very professional, answered all emails in a timely manner, and able to help guide students in the right direction.

the course materials are excellent! very clear and organized slides. the instructor is really responsible and gives students timely feedback. I like the class and i learnt a lot. The homework sometimes can be a bit tedious and some questions are repeated. and I feel like the hand calculation can be cut a bit.
Very useful and clear class. Reasonable working load and assignment
It's taught in a way that is interesting and challenging, and the material is organized into slide decks that make it simple to apply to homework and projects.
Very clear and well-prganized. The ppt slides were extremely detailed and useful.Practical homework assignments. Overall great course.

strength: explain everything clearly and patiently. Teaching style is really good!
I suggest professor provide more lab sessions.
Excellent! Organized, thorough, good examples. Encourage using examples from her own work to make more "real world" to add to her well worked out examples in the slides.
Great instructor and very nice and helpful
The best instructor at YSPH biostatistics

Professor gives very clear and organized lectures, which I appreciate.
Maria is a excellent instructor who can make all points clear. and the slides she designed were extremely helpful.

D. Ciarleglio is a great instructor. She is very well-organized and she updates students ahead if any change happens (since the course is structured very effectively, it hardly happened). She explains the topics very clearly and her lecture slides are perfect!
Perfect instructor.
I like Maria's teaching style, I think she should give a 5 minute break during lectures, just because it is hard to focus for 2 hours straight without any break.
Maria is excellent, she makes the concepts really clear and easy to understand.
Her homework was very helpful.
She is very easy going and approachable. She does a tremendous job with her slides. All the details are included in the powerpoint which will be a good resources for years to come.

She's wonderful.
Professor Ciarleglio has a fabulous teaching style. She explains things very clearly and her slides are the best!
Patient after-course question answer, detailed during-lecture teaching and gave good examples to the questions.
Good lecturer. The slides are very detailed and the layout is fantastic. I appreciate the level of thoroughness provided in the slides, including examples in R and SAS.

Very nice, but her lectures were a little dry and long-winded. She also was not very good at looking at the class (away from the slideshow) and noticing when students raised their hands with questions.
Great instructor. Her lectures were very organized and flowed very well, her examples in the class were illustrative of bigger concepts.

I would recommend this course if the student wants to learn anything about survival. But calculus knowledge is almost a must, so I recommend to review it before starting the course.
Even though this course is very hard for me, after this semester, I have a better understanding of model building and survival analysis. Very useful.

I would highly recommend this course to others especially if you work with longitudinal data often. Maria does a great job of considering theory and application and you walk away with great code to be able to use.
A great course!

I would definitely recommend this course, since it could let you understand the whole concepts for the survival analysis, including the basic underlying theory and also how to use statistical software to perform the analysis.

I recommend it to other students. Great professor and great class materials (slides, examples and homeworks).

Great course to learn survival analysis. Students should be ready to engage in theoretical aspects of Survival which may not be applicable to CDE students and epidemiology research.
